title: SQLiteProxy – A Simple HTTP JSON Proxy for SQLite
author: assafmo
content: readme.md sqliteproxy simple http json proxy sqlite. probably should be exposed end users. :-)  installationnpm install -g sqliteproxyoptionsusage: sqliteproxy [options]options: --db: db file path (default: "") --[]readonly: open database readonly (default: false) --port: tcp port listen (default: 2048) ( number)usage examplesexisting db$ sqliteproxy --db ./examples/vt.sqlite ^z[1] + 23436 suspended sqliteproxy --db ./examples/vt.sqlite$ bg[1] + 23436 continued sqliteproxy --db ./examples/vt.sqlite$ curl 'http://localhost:2048' \-d sql='select * vt where md5 = "0060cc2e24f259545558ebd8834dc345"' -l | jq . # post /[ { "md5": "0060cc2e24f259545558ebd8834dc345", "av_score": "7/61" }]$ curl 'http://localhost:2048' -g \--data-urlencode sql='select * vt where md5 = "0060cc2e24f259545558ebd8834dc345"' -l | jq . # /[ { "md5": "0060cc2e24f259545558ebd8834dc345", "av_score": "7/61" }]$ curl 'http://localhost:2048' -d sql='create table x()' -l[]$ curl 'http://localhost:2048' -d sql='drop table x' -l []$ fg[1] + 23436 running sqliteproxy --db ./examples/vt.sqlite^cread $ sqliteproxy --db ./examples/vt.sqlite --readonly ^z[1] + 23447 suspended sqliteproxy --db ./examples/vt.sqlite --readonly$ bg[1] + 23447 continued sqliteproxy --db ./examples/vt.sqlite --readonly$ curl 'http://localhost:2048' -d sql='create table x()' -l{"errno":8,"code":"sqlite_readonly"}$ fg[1] + 23447 running sqliteproxy --db ./examples/vt.sqlite --readonly^c db$ sqliteproxy --db mynewdb.sqlite ^z[1] + 23453 suspended sqliteproxy --db mynewdb.sqlite$ bg[1] + 23453 continued sqliteproxy --db mynewdb.sqlite$ curl 'http://localhost:2048' -d sql='create table x()' -l[]$ curl 'http://localhost:2048' -d sql='insert x values (1),(2),(3)' -l []$ curl 'http://localhost:2048' -d sql='select * x' -l[ { "": 1 }, { "": 2 }, { "": 3 }]$ fg[1] + 23453 running sqliteproxy --db mynewdb.sqlite^clicensemit
